project_abstract.cdata: The primary objective of the Post-conflict Emergency Reconstruction Project is to support the Government's strategy for the successful implementation of the Peace Agreement by facilitating the reintegration of the Karategin-Tavildara Valley area into the national economy through a targeted agricultural development.  The project will help finance the following components: a) agricultural support including the emergency purchase and distribution of agricultural inputs to private farmers for the Spring 1998 planting season; b) bridges and roads providing for the repair or reconstruction of about fifteen destroyed or damaged bridges as well as the completion of a 4kms by-pass road for the town of Darband to replace the currently existing non-functional road; c) small community works aiming at the reconstruction, repair and/or rehabilitation of destroyed, damaged or dilapidated schools, health care facilities and other community facilities as well as the implementation of other programs of small works benefiting local communities in the Karategin-Tavildara Valley area; and d) other infrastructure works providing for the repair and rehabilitation of war-damaged infrastructure elements in the power and agriculture sector.
